Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior; lip glazed; below, black-figure decoration consisting of a komos scene; naked youth with added red hair and red patch on breast dancing to right; on either side, part of possibly naked women; at right, white arm and foot; at left, hand and possibly raised knee.
Curator's comments: Three other unnumbered sherds from Naukratis (now numbered British Museum 1965,0930.762, 1965,0930.763 and 1965,0930.764) were thought by Beazley to belong with this sherd, but these sherds come from a different cup or cups, as they are thicker and have a different curvature.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.34)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 270, no. 57)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 400, no. B591)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 235, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0529) (Phase 1)
